== JAP_WS_REMOTE_DOTCLOUD ==
 * PREPARATION
  * create [https://www.dotcloud.com/ dotCloud] account
  * install the [http://docs.dotcloud.com/0.9/firststeps/install/ CLI] [http://docs.dotcloud.com/0.9/guides/migration/ 0.9]
 * DEPLOY
  * unzip JAP_REMOTE_×_DOTCLOUD-X.X.X.zip
  * open JAP_REMOTE_×_DOTCLOUD-X.X.X
  * configure JAP_REMOTE_×.json× ([EXAMPLES#Example_4 Example 4])
  * open CONSOLE
    * $ cd JAP_REMOTE_NODE_DOTCLOUD-X.X.X
    * $ dotcloud create APPLICATION-ID
    * $ dotcloud push -A APPLICATION-ID
 * *ATTENTION*
   * REMOTE_PROXY_SERVERS HTTP port=80
   * REMOTE_PROXY_SERVERS HTTPS port=443

== JAP_WS_REMOTE_OPENSHIFT ==
 * PREPARATION
   * create [https://openshift.redhat.com/app/ OpenShift] account
   * install [https://openshift.redhat.com/community/get-started rhc]
 * DEPLOY
   * unzip JAP_WS_REMOTE_PYTHON_OPENSHIFT-X.X.X.zip
   * open JAP_WS_REMOTE_PYTHON_OPENSHIFT-X.X.X
   * configure JAP_WS_REMOTE.json ([EXAMPLES#Example_5 Example 5])
   * open CONSOLE
     * rhc app create -a application-id -t diy-0.1
     * cd application-id
     * xcopy ..\JAP_WS_REMOTE_PYTHON_OPENSHIFT-X.X.X\*.* /s
     * git add -A
     * git commit -m "JAP"
     * git push
 * *ATTENTION*
   * REMOTE_PROXY_SERVERS HTTP port=8000
   * REMOTE_PROXY_SERVERS HTTPS port=8443
